alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Mason; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 1:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL MASON, ROBERTSON, LEWIS, SOUTHEASTERN BROWN, SOUTHERN ADAMS AND SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 125 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near South Webster to Lewisburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Portsmouth, Maysville, Wheelersburg, Washington, West Union, New Boston, Manchester, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, South Webster, Lewisburg, Rosemount, Clarktown, Camp Dix, Rome, Lucasville, Franklin Furnace, Tollesboro, Sciotodale and Blue Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for northern and northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
